item.title: Did you know you can use @metaquest 3 to turn wild VR sculptures into printed toys?
item.description: Did you know you can use @metaquest 3 to turn wild VR sculptures into printed toys? Well @tokyo.tommy does! Tommy says displaying his work on @instagram has cultivated a close community and he often gets messages from followers asking for advice or tips on 3D sculpting and creative techniques. â€œI remember a specific moment when a young follower told me that watching my content inspired him to start his own creative project. It was really meaningful to realize that what I share isnâ€™t just entertainment, but can also motivate others to embrace and express their own creativity.â€ | ğŸ‘ 8665 Ø¥Ø¹Ø¬Ø§Ø¨ | ğŸ’¬ 267 ØªØ¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‚
item.content:encoded:
Did you know you can use @metaquest 3 to turn wild VR sculptures into printed toys? Well @tokyo.tommy does! Tommy says displaying his work on @instagram has cultivated a close community and he often gets messages from followers asking for advice or tips on 3D sculpting and creative techniques. â€œI remember a specific moment when a young follower told me that watching my content inspired him to start his own creative project. It was really meaningful to realize that what I share isnâ€™t just entertainment, but can also motivate others to embrace and express their own creativity.â€

item.title: Just casually making a microcosmic universe, nbd. This dazzling Reel from @l__evans was filmed using...
item.description: Just casually making a microcosmic universe, nbd. This dazzling Reel from @l__evans was filmed using a 120mm macro lens with a combination of water, acrylic ink, and mica. A photographer and self-described experimental artist, Luke tells us that he has only recently started filming himself as he creates little galaxies, not scripting anything, just sharing genuine captivating moments on @instagram. â€œI make my Reels with Edits, and I particularly love how itâ€™s able to keep all the detail and ties in so well directly with Instagramâ€”quite a few people have asked me how I get the Reels to look so detailed!â€ Luke credits his IG presence for exposing him to art directors, getting his work published in magazines and even helping him find new assistants and stylists for shoots. â€œWhatâ€™s surprised me the most is now when I go to events, people actually know what I look like, so I get approached and have conversations with people who otherwise might have missed me! Just this week Iâ€™ve met with two other photographers who found me through my Reels, and we were able to talk really deeply about the highs and lows of being an artist, exploring new, positive ideas of how to share work, and how Instagram is helping smaller accounts like mine break outâ€”it was a really refreshing experience.â€ | ğŸ‘ 28364 Ø¥Ø¹Ø¬Ø§Ø¨ | ğŸ’¬ 183 ØªØ¹Ù„ÙŠÙ‚
item.content:encoded:
Just casually making a microcosmic universe, nbd. This dazzling Reel from @l__evans was filmed using a 120mm macro lens with a combination of water, acrylic ink, and mica. A photographer and self-described experimental artist, Luke tells us that he has only recently started filming himself as he creates little galaxies, not scripting anything, just sharing genuine captivating moments on @instagram. â€œI make my Reels with Edits, and I particularly love how itâ€™s able to keep all the detail and ties in so well directly with Instagramâ€”quite a few people have asked me how I get the Reels to look so detailed!â€ Luke credits his IG presence for exposing him to art directors, getting his work published in magazines and even helping him find new assistants and stylists for shoots. â€œWhatâ€™s surprised me the most is now when I go to events, people actually know what I look like, so I get approached and have conversations with people who otherwise might have missed me! Just this week Iâ€™ve met with two other photographers who found me through my Reels, and we were able to talk really deeply about the highs and lows of being an artist, exploring new, positive ideas of how to share work, and how Instagram is helping smaller accounts like mine break outâ€”it was a really refreshing experience.â€
